title: Falla al iniciar sesión en un sitio (bucle eterno de inicio de sesión)
content:
Hola.

Nunca he tenido problemas para iniciar sesión a mi cuenta local de JW.ORG desde Firefox (laptop) pero ahora no puedo iniciar sesión porque luego de ingresar usuario y clave se queda en un bucle eterno donde intenta hacer la validación, luego vuelve a la URL anterior e intenta validar de nuevo... y así eternamente, este problema sigue ocurriendo cada 1 seg aproximadamente y no logro iniciar sesión. El sitio destino (JW.ORG) no tiene problemas ya que puedo iniciar sesión perfectamente desde otros navegadores web, intenté borrar el caché de Mozilla, reiniciarlo, reinstalar, pero nada. No logro solucionar el problema, ¿alguna ayuda?
creator: ffelipecuevasc

title: FIDO2 Key Registration Fails in Firefox 104.0.2 on Lubuntu 22.04
content:
Vanguard Securities is requiring we replace our U2F security keys with FIDO2 keys before Sep 20, 2022. So I bought a new Thetis FIDO2 key and attempted to register it on the Vanguard site. It fails with no error message on the registration screen. So I tried the following:

  • Tried a different site - it also failed to complete with no error message
  • Turned OFF all ad tracking blockers and pop-up blockers
  • Tried a different (new) key - Failed
  • Tweaked WebAuth in about:config - Failed
  • Tried a different computer but still Firefox - Failed
  • Tried registering the new key as a U2F (it's backwards compatible) - Failed too
  • Searched internet for information - Bugzilla reports that the WebAuth issue was resolved with Ver 99
  • And all of course with the obligatory logout-login/ reboot keyboard dance
  • Out of desperation I installed Chrome - it worked just fine

Everyone reports that Firefox should work with FIDO2. Is there a problem or am I missing something???
creator: yulem007

title: Colar textos copiados de PDF sem quebras de linha
content:
Olá,

uma das principais diferenças de usabilidade entre os google chrome e mozilla firefox é que no chrome ao copiar texto de pdf e colar em um editor de textos, o texto é colado já sem as quebras de linha. O mesmo não ocorre no firefox, que após colar o texto, é necessário remover cada quebra de linha. Ao meu ver, seria interessante se o firefox pudesse implementar também essa funcionalidade de colar os textos com as quebras de linha removidas automaticamente.

Atenciosamente, Vinicius

Hello,

one of the main differences in usability between google chrome and mozilla firefox is that in chrome when copying text from pdf and paste into a text editor, the text is pasted without the line breaks. The same does not occur in firefox, where after pasting the text, it is necessary to remove each line break. In my opinion, it would be interesting if firefox could also implement this functionality to paste the text with the line breaks removed automatically.

Sincerely, Vinicius

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

title: What are there different profiles? Why is "default" not the default?
content:
Today I stumbled on an issue that seems to have affected a number of users who care about profiles. The issue is articulated well here. It appears that a clean installation of Firefox results in the creation of two profiles, one called "default-release" and another "default" where "default-release" is the default. Ugh.

Can any user safely delete the "default" profile and rename the "default-release" profile to "default" to restore a simple, uncomplicated configuration? Why wouldn't Firefox do this by default?

I understand from question 1264072 that Firefox did this intentionally to support multiple installs and release channels, but why shouldn't the "default" profile be used by default? Surely a user who is not performing multiple installs or dealing with multiple release channels shouldn't have their profile names polluted by unaffected concerns.
creator: jaraco

title: Delayed Browser Actions
content: I am experiencing delayed reaction in the Firefox browser. I'm currently using Firefox Browser version 104.0.2 (64 bit) and Windows 11 Home (64 bit). When in the browser, all actions are delayed. This includes typing, scrolling, hovering/highlighting, selecting, etc. The delay appears to be a cyclical process. For example, as I'm typing a sentence one or two letters appear, then it pauses for a second or two, then more letters appear, then a pause again, etc. The same type of cycle happens with scrolling and other functions. I have tried two other browsers on the same system without any similar delay. I have seen posts of similar problems dating back many years, and while some fixes were recommended, either the underlying problems were corrected in subsequent versions or the fix action is to a setting that is no longer part of the Firefox system. Please help.
